MarsVars

The MarsVars executable is for …

The executable requires x arguments:

  • [-x –x] define

Third-party Requirements:

  • numpy

  • argparse

  • requests

List of Functions:

  • x

MarsVars.compute_p_3D(ps, ak, bk, shape_out)

Return the 3D pressure field at the layer midpoint. * NOTE* The shape_out argument ensures that when time = 1 (one timestep), results are returned as (1, lev, lat, lon) not (lev, lat, lon)

MarsVars.compute_rho(p_3D, temp)

Returns density in [kg/m3].

MarsVars.compute_xzTau(q, temp, lev, const, f_type)

Returns dust or ice extinction in [km-1]. Adapted from Heavens et al. 2011, observations by MCS (JGR).

MarsVars.compute_mmr(xTau, temp, lev, const, f_type)

Return dust or ice mixing ratio [kg/kg] Adapted from Heavens et al. 2011. observations by MCS (JGR)

MarsVars.compute_Vg_sed(xTau, nTau, temp)

Returns the dust sedimentation rate.

MarsVars.compute_w_net(Vg, wvar)

Returns the net vertical wind (subtracts the sedimentation rate (Vg_sed) from the vertical wind (w)) w_net = w - Vg_sed

MarsVars.compute_theta(p_3D, ps, temp, f_type)

Returns the potential temperature in [K].

MarsVars.compute_zfull(ps, ak, bk, temp)

Returns the altitude of the layer midpoints AGL in [m].

MarsVars.compute_zhalf(ps, ak, bk, temp)

Returns the altitude of the layer interfaces AGL in [m]

MarsVars.compute_DZ_full_pstd(pstd, temp, ftype='average')

Returns the thickness of a layer (distance between two layers) from the midpoint of the standard pressure levels (‘pstd’).

Args:

pstd: 1D array of standard pressure in [Pa] temp: 3D array of temperature ftype: ‘daily’, ‘aveage’, or ‘diurn’

Returns:

DZ_full_pstd: 3D array of thicknesses

* NOTE* In this context, ‘pfull’ = ‘pstd’ with the layer interfaces defined somewhere in between successive layers.

— Nk — TOP ======== phalf — Nk-1 —

——– pfull = pstd ^
DZ_full_pstd

======== phalf |

— 1 — ——– pfull = pstd v — 0 — SFC ======== phalf

/ / / /

MarsVars.compute_N(theta, zfull)

Returns the Brunt Vaisala freqency in [rad/s].

MarsVars.compute_Tco2(P_3D, temp)

Returns the frost point of CO2 in [K]. Adapted from Fannale, 1982. Mars: The regolith-atmosphere cap system and climate change. Icarus.

MarsVars.compute_scorer(N, ucomp, zfull)

Returns the Scorer wavelength in [m].

MarsVars.compute_DP_3D(ps, ak, bk, shape_out)

Returns the thickness of a layer in [Pa].

MarsVars.compute_DZ_3D(ps, ak, bk, temp, shape_out)

Returns the layer thickness in [Pa].

MarsVars.compute_Ep(temp)

Returns the wave potential energy (Ep) in [J/kg]. Ep = 1/2 (g/N)**2 (T’/T)**2

MarsVars.compute_Ek(ucomp, vcomp)

Returns the wave kinetic energy (Ek) in [J/kg]. Ek= 1/2 (u’**2+v’**2)

MarsVars.compute_MF(UVcomp, w)

Returns the zonal or meridional momentum fluxes (u’w’ or v’w’).

MarsVars.compute_WMFF(MF, rho, lev, interp_type)

Returns the zonal or meridional wave-mean flow forcing ax= -1/rho d(rho u’w’)/dz in [m/s/s] ay= -1/rho d(rho v’w’)/dz in [m/s/s]

For ‘pstd’:

[du/dz = (du/dp).(dp/dz)] > [du/dz = -rho g (du/dp)] with dp/dz = -rho g
